alert.note: Alert for Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Yalobusha, northeastern Tallahatchie, southeastern Quitman and southern Panola Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crowder, or 10 miles north of Charleston, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... George Payne State Park, Crowder, Pope, Enid, Oakland, Courtland, Mims, Asa, Chapeltown and Tillatoba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
